title: Thai September exports seen rising 1.2% year-on-year: Reuters poll
text:
Thai September exports seen rising 1.2% year-on-year: Reuters poll

Economic Indicators 44 minutes ago (Oct 18, 2019 03:21AM ET)

BANGKOK (Reuters) - Thailand's customs-cleared exports likely grew 1.2% in September from a year earlier, after declining 4% in the previous month, a Reuters poll showed on Friday. Imports in September are expected to have fallen 5.35%, after decreasing 14.62% in August, according to the median forecast of 10 analysts in the poll. Thailand likely recorded a trade surplus of $2.22 billion in September, compared with a surplus of $2.05 billion in August. The commerce ministry targets export growth of 3% this year. However, last month, an official from the ministry had said it would be difficult to achieve the target.

Thai September exports seen rising 1.2% year-on-year: Reuters poll
description: Thai September exports seen rising 1.2% year-on-year: Reuters poll
